content.question: Which of the following statements is true regarding western European family life in the period 1750-1850?

choices.label: There was an increased importance placed on child-rearing among the upper classes.
There was a significant decline in out-ofÂ­ wedlock births due to Enlightenment reforms.
Life expectancy declined due to the hazards associated with industrialization.
The birth rate increased significantly due to government social welfare programs.
Most nations repealed laws that enforced the legal and economic inferiority of women.

content.answer: There was an increased importance placed on child-rearing among the upper classes.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
